title: Stansted Airport welcomes Sir Peter Hendy’s support for faster journey times to Stansted and CambridgeTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Stansted Airport welcomes Sir Peter Hendy’s support for faster journey times to Stansted and Cambridge Published on : Tuesday, September 29, 2015
Sir Peter Hendy, giving his first speech as Chairman of Network Rail at a Crossrail 2 stakeholder event in London, confirmed that journey time improvements to Stansted Airport and Cambridge are being taken forward as an option in the forthcoming Anglia Route Study which is due to be published next month.
Commenting on Sir Peter Hendy’s remarks, Andrew Harrison, Managing Director of Stansted Airport said:
“I am very encouraged by Sir Peter’s positive words which indicate that Network Rail has listened to calls from passengers and commuters for faster journey times on the West Anglia Mainline and plan to set out a far more ambitious 30 year vision for the future of rail in the East of England than was originally expected.
“We now hope Government will take forward a sustained programme of rail investment beginning with journey time improvements to Stansted and Cambridge in the short term, leading to four-tracking in the mid-2020s and full integration with Crossrail 2 services around 2030.
“These vital improvements will not only help to foster growth, productivity and regeneration along the entire London-Stansted-Cambridge corridor but also unlock spare runway capacity at Stansted Airport at a time when it’s in short supply in the south east.”
Greg Clark, Chair of the London Stansted Cambridge Consortium, said:
“As a member of both the Crossrail 2 Growth Commission and the West Anglia Taskforce I am well aware of the commitment from senior politicians, officials and businesses in delivering significant improvements in this line. Sir Peter’s comments are very welcome as we continue to work closely with Network Rail and the Department to push for infrastructure investment in the region.”
